title: Add index performance snapshot list to Dashboard

requirements.text: Add a dashboard "Index Performance" snapshot that shows % change for the following indices and sorts them in descending order by % change: Nifty50, Bank Nifty, Nifty Mid Select, Sensex, Finnifty, Nifty Pvt Bank, Nifty PSU Bank, Nifty IT, Nifty Pharma, Nifty FMCG, Nifty Auto, Nifty Metal, Nifty Energy, Nifty Realty.

quotes: following are the index whose performance i want to see in dashboard: nifty50, bank nifty, nifty mid select, sensex, finnifty, nifty pvt bank, nifty psu bank, nifty it, nifty pharma, nifty fmcg, nifty auto, nifty metal, nifty energy, nifty realty.

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard includes an "Index Performance" section visible above or alongside the existing Bull/Bear scan results.
The section displays one row per index from the provided list.
Each row includes the index name and its current % change value.
Rows are sorted by % change in descending order (highest % change at the top).
All user-facing labels in this section are in English.

requirements.text: Implement backend support to provide index performance (% change) data for the Dashboard index list, returning a single payload that the frontend can render and sort.

quotes: following are the index whose performance i want to see in dashboard: nifty50, bank nifty, nifty mid select, sensex, finnifty, nifty pvt bank, nifty psu bank, nifty it, nifty pharma, nifty fmcg, nifty auto, nifty metal, nifty energy, nifty realty.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a new query method that returns index performance entries for the specified index names.
Each returned entry contains: index name and numeric % change.
If index performance data cannot be fetched for an index, the entry is still returned with an explicit missing/empty value that the UI can display as unavailable (without crashing).
Method is access-controlled consistently with existing user-only queries (same authorization pattern as getResults/getStatus).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any path listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not implement Top Gainers / Top Losers in this change (even though it was discussed earlier).
Do not change the existing bull/bear scan logic or results tables as part of this index snapshot change.
